alert.note: Alert for Lancaster; Northumberland; Richmond; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 4:01PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Northumberland, east central Richmond, southeastern Westmoreland and northeastern Lancaster Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 401 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Hague to near Lewisetta to near Fair Port. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Fair Port, Robley, Callao, Kinsale, Coles Point, Hague, Lewisetta, Heathsville, Wicomico Church, Haynesville, Westmoreland, Lottsburg, Threeway, Regina, Avalon, Reedville, Edwardsville, Middletons Corner, Dodlyt and Rehoboth Church. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern and east central Virginia.
